Ix Soulcist xI:

Well that makes sense, can’t wait to see it finished.

same here, I spent the last bit working on my npc system. I have the updating done, right now I am writing the formulas to calculate their stats / weaknesses. Currently I am leaning towards giving npc’s stats just like players.

[quote=“Rash, post:6, topic:387896”]Good luck with this.
I hope to see it go far.[/quote]
Thanks man, I hope it does good as well.

Aeronity:

Good luck bro, I hope this goes far.

Thanks man.

Clawz fury:

Looks amazing, good luck

Thanks dude.

EDIT:: UPDATE

Magic base done.
Like everything else, combat is entity based so it will work on pvp and pvn.

item.title: Vitality-Simplistic and powerful: you can run; but you can't escape.[More pics]
item.dc:creator: @glestrts glestrts
item.description:
@glestrts wrote:

[size=14pt][CENTER]Update Log[/CENTER]
April 12 - Magic base done.
random fixes, a lot of work on ranged, and friends list.
April 18 - Re-tweaked magic. Currently Npc’s can cast the same spells as players, and players the same spells as npc’s. (i.e. I can cast jad’s spell).
April 19 - Spent some time working on trading, I have finished the system for it, I just need to find the packets.

[size=14pt][CENTER]Current Features[/CENTER]
Combat
Magic - all combat spells added, need to finish all spell effects
Melee - very basic now, needs a lot of work
Prayer - done, prayer switching works fine. Need to add retribution, protection prayers, and smite and it is done.
Ranged.
Specials - started

Skills
Runecrafting - I still need abyss
Herblore
Thieving
Teleporting
Eating food.

[size=14pt][CENTER]Background Information[/CENTER]

This source is based off of a source I did based off of the original flight around runescape (which you can get here: Index of /origrs2/). Most of the code was based off of either shards and rs2hd at this time. Roughly around december I did a major rewrite where I scrapped nearly everything and recleaned the server to about 30 kb in total.

For a portion of its development after this point it was hosted open source on a google code svn. However, as time progressed, I realized that the last thing that I wanted to do was to provide people with an incomplete base. The source is currently hosted on a private svn. I am largely undecided as to what to ultimately do with this, but what ever I decide, I know I will have fun doing it.

[size=14pt][CENTER]The Source[/CENTER]
The server itself is in many area’s similar to servers like hyperion in term of the design. (Hyperion just has more features). However, this server aims to be more user friendly and easier for the average beginner to start on.
Current Source Layout:

A look at the source package by package.
com.sigma- essentially the main center of the server. Contains all classes related to entities, starting up the server, and also the GameEngine.
com.sigma.content- basically content related features that are not explicitly related to skills or combat. Some examples of these would be clues, cannons, and also food.
com.sigma.content.combat- All classes related to data used for combat.
com.sigma.content.combat.styles- Consists of combat styles implementing the combat interface. Currently melee and ranged are added.
com.sigma.content.quests- contains quest related methods
com.sigma.content.skills- contains the skills, teleporting, runecrafting, prayer, and herblore are currently done completely.
com.sigma.content.skills.data- contains static methods for each skill, and also all skill related enums and arrays in seperate classes.
Currently, Runecrafting, prayer, teleporting, herblore, fletching, mining, thieving, slayer, crafting, and woodcutting are complete.
com.sigma.items- Contains the item container system, and the classes for the player inventory, bank, trade, staking, and equipment.
com.sigma.logic- Contains the classes for events and ticks (which implement the task interface) and also an action system.
com.sigma.logic.events- All classes that extend event
com.sigma.logic.tasks- All classes that extent task, can be executed synchronously or asynchronously.
com.sigma.net- Contains all networking related stuff, starting the networking threadpool, binding to a port, etc.
com.sigma.net.event- represents a networking event, this is a WIP package inspired by event based API’s such as Netty.
com.sigma.net.packets- Contains packets.
com.sigma.region- Region system (100% hyperion)
com.sigma.util- Contains javascript loader, logger, entitycollections.

[size=14pt][CENTER]The Development[/CENTER]

I have made skills for a long while, so they have been pretty easy to make the bases for.
However, I have never made a combat system before, so it definitely poses a challenge. It was hard, however, it wasn’t that bad. Combat is entity based. So pvp, pvn, nvp, and nvn all work fine.

[size=14pt][CENTER]The Future Plan[/CENTER]

I tend not to think about this, because the source is, and will always be developed in the present.

[size=14pt][CENTER]The Media[/CENTER]





[size=14pt][CENTER]Code Snippets[/CENTER]

Reads all incoming data using the runescape protocol.

import java.nio.ByteBuffer;

/**
 * The Stream class rewritten to use ByteBuffer.
 * @author Advocatus, MITB, Blakeman8192.
 */
public final class InStream {

 * *private ByteBuffer buffer;

 * *public InStream(ByteBuffer buffer) {
	this.buffer = buffer;
 * *}

 * *public ByteBuffer getBuffer() {
	return buffer;
 * *}

 * *public byte readSignedByte() {
	return buffer.get();
 * *}

 * *public byte readSignedByteA() {
	return (byte) (buffer.get() - 128);
 * *}

 * *public byte readSignedByteC() {
	return (byte) (-buffer.get());
 * *}

 * *public byte readSignedByteS() {
	return (byte) (128 - buffer.get());
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedByte() {
	return buffer.get() & 0xff;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedByteA() {
	return buffer.get() - 128 & 0xff;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedByteC() {
	return -buffer.get() & 0xff;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedByteS() {
	return 128 - buffer.get() & 0xff;
 * *}

 * *public int readSignedWord() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	return value;
 * *}

 * *public int readSignedWordBigEndian() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	return value;
 * *}

 * *public int readSignedWordA() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	value |= readUnsignedByteA();
	return value;
 * *}

 * *public int readSignedWordBigEndianA() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByteA();
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	return value;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedWord() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	return value & 0xffff;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedWordBigEndian() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	return value & 0xffff;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedWordA() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	value |= readUnsignedByteA();
	return value & 0xffff;
 * *}

 * *public int readUnsignedWordBigEndianA() {
	int value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByteA();
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	return value & 0xffff;
 * *}

 * *public int readDWord() {
	long value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 24;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 16;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	return (int) value;
 * *}

 * *public int readDWord_v1() {
	long value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 24;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 16;
	return (int) value;
 * *}

 * *public int readDWord_v2() {
	long value = 0;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 16;
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 24;
	value |= readUnsignedByte();
	value |= readUnsignedByte() << 8;
	return (int) value;
 * *}

 * *public long readQWord() {
	long l = (long) readDWord() & 0xffffffffL;
	long l1 = (long) readDWord() & 0xffffffffL;
	return (l << 32) + l1;
 * *}

 * *public String readString() {
	byte temp;
	StringBuilder b = new StringBuilder();
	while ((temp = (byte) readSignedByte()) != 10) {
	 * *b.append((char) temp);
	}
	return b.toString();
 * *}

 * *public void readBytes(byte abyte0[], int i, int j) {
	for (int k = j; k < j + i; k++) {
	 * *abyte0[k] = buffer.get();
	}
 * *}

 * *public void readBytes_reverse(byte abyte0[], int i, int size) {
	for (int k = (i + size - 1); k >= i; k--) {
	 * *abyte0[k] = buffer.get();
	}
 * *}

 * *public void readBytes_reverseA(byte abyte0[], int i, int size) {
	for (int k = (i + size - 1); k >= i; k--) {
	 * *abyte0[k] = readSignedByteA();
	}
 * *}
}

Javascript Script loader (Initial version, will probably redo).

package com.sigma.util;

import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.FileNotFoundException;
import java.io.InputStreamReader;
import java.util.HashMap;

import javax.script.Invocable;
import javax.script.ScriptEngine;
import javax.script.ScriptEngineManager;
import javax.script.ScriptException;

import com.sigma.Config;

/**
 * Manages server sided js scripting.
 * @author Advocatus.
 */
public class JavaScriptManager {

 * */**
 * * * Creates the js scripting engine.
 * * */
 * *private ScriptEngine jsEngine = null;
 * */**
 * * * Creates a map that contains all scripts.
 * * */
 * *private HashMap<String, ScriptEngine> scriptMap = new HashMap<String, ScriptEngine>();

 * */**
 * * * Creates the script manager.
 * * */
 * *public JavaScriptManager() {
	jsEngine = new ScriptEngineManager().getEngineByName("JavaScript");
	scriptMap.clear();
	loadScripts(Config.SCRIPTS_DIRECTORY);
	System.out.println("Loading scripts...");
 * *}

 * */**
 * * * Invokes a JavaScript function.
 * * * @param call The name of the file and function separated by a "."
 * * * @param args The function arguments.
 * * */
 * *public void call(String call, Object... args) {
	int dotIndex = call.indexOf('.');
	String scriptName = call.substring(0, (dotIndex != -1 ? dotIndex : call.length()));
	String funcName = null;
	if (dotIndex != -1) {
	 * *funcName = call.substring(dotIndex + 1, call.length());
	}
	ScriptEngine e = scriptMap.get(scriptName);
	Invocable invEngine = (Invocable) e;
	try {
	 * *invEngine.invokeFunction(funcName, args);
	} catch (NoSuchMethodException ex) {
	 * *System.err.println("No such method: " + funcName);
	} catch (ScriptException ex) {
	 * *System.err.println("ScriptException thrown!");
	}
 * *}

 * */**
 * * * Loads JavaScript files into the JavaScript ScriptEngine from the argued
 * * * path.
 * * * @param dirPath The path of the directory to load the JavaScript source
 * * * files from.
 * * */
 * *private void loadScripts(String dirPath) {
	File dir = new File(dirPath);
	for (File child : dir.listFiles()) {
	 * *if (child.isFile()) {
		if (child.getName().endsWith(".js")) {
		 * *String name = child.getAbsolutePath().substring(child.getAbsolutePath().lastIndexOf(File.separatorChar) + 1, child.getAbsolutePath().lastIndexOf(".js")).replace(File.separatorChar, '/');
		 * *try {
			jsEngine.eval(new InputStreamReader(new FileInputStream(child)));
			scriptMap.put(name, jsEngine);
			System.out.println("Loading Script: " + name);
		 * *} catch (ScriptException ex) {
			System.err.println("Unable to load script " + name + "!");
		 * *} catch (FileNotFoundException ex) {
			System.err.println("Unable to find script " + name + "!");
		 * *}
		}
	 * *} else {
		loadScripts(child.getPath());
	 * *}
	}
 * *}
}

Simple logging class, that puts the time in front of all messages.

package com.sigma.util;

import java.io.IOException;
import java.io.OutputStream;
import java.io.PrintStream;
import java.text.DateFormat;
import java.text.SimpleDateFormat;
import java.util.Date;

/**
 * Simple logging utility that puts the time in front of all messages.
 * @author Advocatus, Graham, Blakeman8192
 */
public class SimpleLogger extends PrintStream {
 * */**
 * * * The cached date.
 * * */
 * *private static Date date = new Date();

 * */**
 * * * The date format string.
 * * */
 * *private static DateFormat dateFormat = new SimpleDateFormat("HH:mm:ss");
 * *
 * */**
 * * * The cached formatted date.
 * * */
 * *private static String dateText = dateFormat.format(date);

 * */**
 * * * When the date was last updated.
 * * */
 * *private static long lastUpdatedDate = 0;

 * */**
 * * * The OutputStream to log to.
 * * * @param out
 * * */
 * *public SimpleLogger(OutputStream out) throws IOException {
	super(out);
 * *}

 * *@Override
 * *public void println(String msg) {
	msg = formatMessage(msg);
	super.println(msg);
 * *}

 * */**
 * * * Formats a log message.
 * * * @param message The unformatted message.
 * * * @return The formatted message.
 * * */
 * *private String formatMessage(String message) {
	if (message == null) {
	 * *message = "";
	}
	if (lastUpdatedDate + 500 < System.currentTimeMillis()) {
	 * *lastUpdatedDate = System.currentTimeMillis();
	 * *date = new Date();
	 * *dateText = dateFormat.format(date);
	}
	message = message.replaceAll("\t", " * *");
	return "[" + dateText + "]: " + message;
 * *}

 * */**
 * * * Log a stack trace.
 * * * @param throwable
 * * */
 * *public static void stackTrace(Throwable throwable) {
	System.err.println(throwable.getMessage());
	for (StackTraceElement e : throwable.getStackTrace()) {
	 * *System.err.println(e.toString());
	}
 * *}
}

[size=14pt][CENTER]The credits[/CENTER]
Rs2hd (overall design, Item container system)
Hyperion (GameEngine class, and initial threading system)
Original Winterlove (what this is based on).
Shards (Initial networking)
Blakeman8192 (The rsbuffer class, has been modified by me to be easier for me to use).

If you want to contact me, my msn is: davidcntt@hotmail.com
